text: The Kramatorsk railway bombing was the launching of two missiles at the Kramatorsk railway station in the Ukrainian city of Kramatorsk, Donetsk Oblast on April 8, 2022 during the 2022 Russian invasion of Ukraine. At least 50 people were killed and 87 to 300 people were injured. Ukraine said that the attacks were done by Russia, however Russia denied this and says that Ukraine did the attack on themselves to blame Russia. ==References== Category:2022 Russian invasion of Ukraine Category:2020s building bombings Category:2020s murders in Europe Category:April 2022 events Category:Attacks on buildings and structures in 2022 Category:Attacks on railway systems Category:Building bombings in Europe Category:Donetsk Oblast Category:Mass murder in 2022 Category:War crimes Category:Explosions in 2022
title: Kramatorsk railway station attack
